      • createTransformationMatrix

        public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f createTransformationMatrix(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f translation,
                                                                        org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f scale)
        Creates a transformation matrix to be used for the transformation of 2D gui element with no rotation.
        The matrix is going to be applied to the model each frame.
        Parameters:
        translation - - an x,y translation in world coordinate space
        scale - - scale for transformation of the gui element
        Returns:
        - a 4x4 transformation matrix

      • createTransformationMatrix

        public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f createTransformationMatrix(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f translation,
                                                                        float rx,
                                                                        float ry,
                                                                        float rz,
                                                                        float scale)
        Creates a transformation matrix to be used for the transformation of 3D models.
        The matrix is going to be applied to the model each frame.
        Parameters:
        translation - - an x,y,z translation in world coordinate space
        rx - - rotation value for x - axis
        ry - - rotation value for y - axis
        rz - - rotation value for z - axis
        scale - - scale for transformation of the model
        Returns:
        - a 4x4 transformation matrix

      • createViewMatrix

        public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f createViewMatrix(at.antSim.graphics.entities.Camera camera)
        Creates a view matrix to move the view on the world.

        To make the world seem to move, although the OpenGL coordinates system stays fixed, every object in the world needs to move in the opposite direction of the desired camera direction.

        Hence, the viewMatrix's translation is calculated by multiplying the camera's position with -1.
        Parameters:
        camera - - the Camera used to create the view matrix
        Returns:
        - a 4x4 view matrix

      • barryCentric

        public static float barryCentric(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f p1,
                                 org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f p2,
                                 org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f p3,
                                 float x,
                                 float z)
        Returns height of a triangle at a specific position inside the triangle, using barycentric coordinates of p.
        Basically, barycentric coordinates are kinds of "weights".
        These weights can be used to calculate the coordinates of any point inside a triangle: p = λa*A + λb*B + λc*C.

        Barycentric coordinates explained: http://www.alecjacobson.com/weblog/?p=1596

        I tried to do the calculation myself, but found an apparently much faster code on stack overflow, which I however don't understand mathematically. However, for better performance, this code shall be used: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5507762/how-to-find-z-by-arbitrary-x-y-coordinates-within-triangle-if-you-have-triangle
        Parameters:
        p1 - - first corner point of triangle
        p2 - - second corner point of triangle
        p3 - - third corner point of triangle
        x - - x position inside the triangle at which to calculate the height
        z - - z position inside the triangle at which to calculate the height
        Returns:
        - the height of a triangle at a specific position inside the triangle
